summary: SkyProc Patcher to add recipies for scrolls from active mods in your load order. (For SkyRe!)
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://static-1.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/51110-1-1392404217.png[/img][/center]
[center][color=Black][size=4]by Yoshh[/size][/color][/center]
[color=Black][size=3]Version :[/size][/color] 1.1
[color=Black][size=3]Date :[/size][/color] 16/02/2014
[color=Black][size=3]Category :[/size][/color] Utilities


[center][img]http://static-3.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/51110-1-1392405226.png[/img][/center]
[line]

ScrollProccer is a SkyProc patcher that searches your active mods in your load order for Scrolls and creates recipes for them. The SkyRe mod added a new feature where you can use a quill, ink and paper to create scrolls. ScrollProccer creates those recipes in an automated way, so you won't have to make compatibility patches yourself :)

In the 1.1 version I added a way to "customize" what the patcher... well... patches. You'll have to edit the Exclude.xml that comes with the mod.

[img]http://static-3.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/51110-1-1392553913.png[/img]

[line]

[center][img]http://static-3.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/51110-2-1392405226.png[/img][/center]
I am not entirely sure if the non-English versions of Skyrim have the scroll Editor IDs in English, so I cannot guarantee that the COBJ Editor IDs will have "Scrollof" in their names.
[line]

[center][img]http://static-3.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/51110-3-1392405227.png[/img][/center]
Drag the ScrollProccer folder into your SkyProc Patchers folder.
[line]

[center][img]http://static-3.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/51110-4-1392405227.png[/img][/center]
Simply delete the ScrollProccer folder in your SkyProc Patchers folder.
[line]

[center][img]http://static-3.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/51110-5-1392405228.png[/img][/center]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/9286]SkyRe - Skyrim Redone[/url], obviously.
[line]

[/center]

Any patches that add recipes for scrolls for SkyRe.
